1. Can we please somehow separate the universe tests from the core framework tests? Considering that they are 70k lines, this will greatly increase the readability. We don't have C2 and PyTorch tests in one place.
  2. Do we really believe that 20k line long dumps of protobufs are anything more than a smoke test? No one is going to check those carefully unless they have a whole day free. I'd argue that we should only test simple things like this, and everything more complicated should run verify or sth like this.

body:
1. Can we please somehow separate the universe tests from the core framework tests? Considering that they are 70k lines, this will greatly increase the readability. We don't have C2 and PyTorch tests in one place.
2. Do we really believe that 20k line long dumps of protobufs are anything more than a smoke test? No one is going to check those carefully unless they have a whole day free. I'd argue that we should only test simple things like this, and everything more complicated should run `verify` or sth like this.
